intro: Dryadella sororcula, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dryad, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically greenish-white and clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Dryadella sororcula is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories.
